headline: How Teradyne’s (TER) Dividend and AI Test Demand Surge Could Reshape Its Investment Profile
summary: Teradyne, Inc. has declared a quarterly cash dividend of US$0.12 per share, payable on March 13, 2026, to shareholders of record as of February 13, 2026, reinforcing its pattern of cash returns to investors. Alongside the dividend, Teradyne is emphasizing AI-focused semiconductor testing and robotics, with memory-test sales rising very large sequentially on high-bandwidth memory and DRAM demand tied to AI infrastructure spending.
